action.content:
You are a language wizard who likes to guess words by using the given rules.

Welcome to Wordle! You have six attempts to guess the target word, a valid English word of five lowercase letters (a-z). Please use the tags "explanation:" and "guess:" to provide a concise explanation for each guess.

For instance, if your guess is "apple", your response should be
explanation: this is a common five-letter English word, and I am starting my guess with this word.
guess: apple

After each guess, your answer will be validated, and you will receive feedback indicating which letters are correct (green), which letters are correct but in the wrong position (yellow), and which letters are incorrect (red). This feedback can be useful in determining which letters to include or exclude in your next guess.

For example, the feedback for "apple" might be:
guess_feedback: a<yellow> p<yellow> p<green> l<yellow> e<red>

The explanation should contain details about how the guess_feedback is used to arrive at a new guess.

Do not generate any other text.

Let's begin with your first guess.

explanation: This is a common five-letter English word, and I am starting my guess with this word to gather initial feedback.
guess: apple

attempts = 1
target_word = dizzy
guess = apple
guess_feedback = a<red> p<red> p<red> l<red> e<red>

guess_feedback: a<red> p<red> p<red> l<red> e<red>

Provide your response only in this format.
explanation: details
guess: word

explanation: All letters in "apple" are incorrect, so I will try a completely different set of letters, avoiding a, p, l, and e.
guess: crane

attempts = 2
target_word = dizzy
guess = crane
guess_feedback = c<red> r<red> a<red> n<red> e<red>

guess_feedback: c<red> r<red> a<red> n<red> e<red>

Provide your response only in this format.
explanation: details
guess: word

explanation: None of the letters in "crane" are correct, so I will now try another set of letters, avoiding c, r, a, n, and e.
guess: shout

attempts = 3
target_word = dizzy
guess = shout
guess_feedback = s<red> h<red> o<red> u<red> t<red>

guess_feedback: s<red> h<red> o<red> u<red> t<red>

Provide your response only in this format.
explanation: details
guess: word

explanation: All letters in "shout" are incorrect, so I will now try a completely different set of letters, avoiding s, h, o, u, and t.
guess: gummy

attempts = 4
target_word = dizzy
guess = gummy
guess_feedback = g<red> u<red> m<red> m<red> y<green>

guess_feedback: g<red> u<red> m<red> m<red> y<green>

Provide your response only in this format.
explanation: details
guess: word

explanation: The letter "y" is correct and in the right position. All other letters are incorrect, so I will now try a word ending with "y" while avoiding g, u, and m.
guess: jazzy

attempts = 5
target_word = dizzy
guess = jazzy
guess_feedback = j<red> a<red> z<green> z<green> y<green>

guess_feedback: j<red> a<red> z<green> z<green> y<green>

Provide your response only in this format.
explanation: details
guess: word

explanation: The letters "z" and "y" are correct and in the right positions. The first letter is incorrect, so I will now try a word starting with a different letter while keeping "zzy" at the end.
guess: dizzy

attempts = 6
target_word = dizzy
guess = dizzy
guess_feedback = d<green> i<green> z<green> z<green> y<green>

guess_explanation: This is a common five-letter English word, and I am starting my guess with this word to gather initial feedback.
All letters in "apple" are incorrect, so I will try a completely different set of letters, avoiding a, p, l, and e.
None of the letters in "crane" are correct, so I will now try another set of letters, avoiding c, r, a, n, and e.
All letters in "shout" are incorrect, so I will now try a completely different set of letters, avoiding s, h, o, u, and t.
The letter "y" is correct and in the right position. All other letters are incorrect, so I will now try a word ending with "y" while avoiding g, u, and m.
The letters "z" and "y" are correct and in the right positions. The first letter is incorrect, so I will now try a word starting with a different letter while keeping "zzy" at the end.
